laboratory_examinations.findings: High serum PSTI levels of 98 ng/mL (normal range, 4.6 to 12.2 ng/mL) before onset of symptoms; decreased to 39 ng/mL one month after liver transplantation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PSTI levels decreased from 98 ng/mL before symptoms to 39 ng/mL one month after liver transplantation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Extremely high concentration of plasma citrulline at 415 nmol/mL (normal range, 23 to 51 nmol/mL).
Moderately high serum ammonia levels at 221 mg/dL (normal range, 12 to 66 mg/dL).
Serum triglycerides were 579 mg/dL (normal range, 130 to 220 mg/dL).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Electrolytes, Blood Urea Nitrogen, Creatinine, Blood Gases

laboratory_examinations.findings: Unremarkable initially; repeat CT scan after 4 days showed subtle decreased attenuation of the basal ganglia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Changes noted on repeat CT scan after 4 days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral diffuse slowing of the delta range.
Hyperintense signal of the basal ganglia, hippocampus, and cerebral cortex bilaterally.
